text: The 2018 Ball State Cardinals football team represented Ball State University in the 2018 NCAA Division I FBS football season. They were led by third-year head coach Mike Neu and played their home games at Scheumann Stadium in Muncie, Indiana as members of the West Division of the Mid-American Conference. They finished the season 4–8, 3–5 in MAC play to finish in fifth place in the West Division. == Previous season == The Cardinals finished the 2017 season 2–10, 0–8 in MAC play to finish in last place in the West Division. ==Preseason== ===Award watch lists=== Listed in the order that they were released {| class="wikitable" |- |Rimington Trophy |Andrew Poenitsch |C |JR |- |Maxwell Award |James Gilbert |RB |JR |- |Fred Biletnikoff Award |Justin Hall |WR |SO |- |John Mackey Award |Nolan Givan |TE |SO |- |Paul Hornung Award |Malik Dunner |RB/KR |JR |- |Wuerffel Trophy |Riley Neal |QB |SR |} ===Preseason media poll=== The MAC released their preseason media poll on July 24, 2018, with the Cardinals predicted to finish in last place in the West Division.http://getsomemaction.com/news/2018/7/23/niu-ohio-picked-as- divisional-winners-in-2018-mac-football-media-preseason-poll.aspx {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |align="center" Colspan="3" |West Division |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1 || Northern Illinois || 133 (15) |- align="center" | 2 || Toledo || 125 (7) |- align="center" | 3 || Western Michigan || 87 (1) |- align="center" | 4 || Eastern Michigan || 67 |- align="center" | 5 || Central Michigan || 58 (1) |- align="center" | 6 || Ball State || 34 |} ==Schedule== Source:2018 Ball State Cardinals football schedule. ballstatesports.com.
